intro: Aschersoniodoxa peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its striking, spatulate leaves and showy, white to greenish-yellow inflorescences. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. Its rhizomes are often harvested for their starchy, edible roots, which are used in traditional cuisines. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations.
